entry.title: Feast of Saint James (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a year when the Feast of Saint James falls on a Sunday is designated a Jacobean Holy Year, and the Holy Door (pictured) at the Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela is unblocked for all to enter?

entry.title: coat of arms of Santiago de Compostela (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the coat of arms of Santiago de Compostela features a chalice and host from the Galician arms, as well as a star and the tomb of Saint James?

entry.title: Plaza de la Quintana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the lower level of Santiago de Compostela's Plaza de la Quintana is called the Quintana de Mortos because it was once a cemetery?

entry.title: Berenguela Tower (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during a Jacobean Holy Year, the Berenguela Tower's lantern is lit throughout the year to act as a lighthouse to guide pilgrims to the cathedral?

entry.title: Libredón (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to legend the tomb of James the Apostle was forgotten for eight centuries until it was found by Pelagius in the forest Libredón?

entry.title: Way of the Lighthouses (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that both the Way of the Lighthouses and the Way of Saint James end at Cape Finisterre in Galicia?

entry.title: Cross of Saint James (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Cross of Saint James is associated with the apostle's appearance at the mythical Battle of Clavijo?

entry.title: Queen Lupa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Queen Lupa sent the disciples of James the Apostle to Mount Ilicino without telling them about a dragon?
